Package actor.player

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.image.ImageView
        • actor.Actor
          • actor.player.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Act, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    public class Player
extends Actor
implements Act
    The class which represents the main player object/ frog
    Author:
    psyjpf

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void act​(long now)
      The main act method, which checks every frame the frog is still within the screen, has been hit by a car, has sunken or is at the end of the game.

      Check if the player is at an end goal of the level and if so change the goals state and reset the frog to the start.

      Decreases the number of lives by one, when the player dies.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player​(java.lang.String imageLink,
              java.lang.Integer lives,
              Observer observer,
              int waterLevel)
        Constructs a new player object and links up event handlers When the WASD keys are pressed the frog will walk and change it's state.
        Parameters:
        imageLink - Defines the location of the start sprite image
        waterLevel - Defines the water level, so the player knows if it is above water or not.
        lives - Defines the number of lives the player has.
        observer - the Observer to notify when the player score changes and hence game state

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act​(long now)
        The main act method, which checks every frame the frog is still within the screen, has been hit by a car, has sunken or is at the end of the game.
        Specified by:
        act in interface Act
        Parameters:
        now - The current frame the animation timer of the program is currently on.

      • withInXBounds

        private void withInXBounds()
        If the frog is outside of the X bounds of the screen put in back within.

      • withInYBounds

        private void withInYBounds()
        If the frog is outside the Y bounds of the screen put it back inside.

      • hasHitCar

        private void hasHitCar()
        If the frog has been hit by a car set it's state to Car Death

      • checkIfSunken

        private void checkIfSunken()
        Check if the Turtle the player is on is sunken or not, if so set water death.

      • movingWithSafeActor

        private boolean movingWithSafeActor()
        If a frog is on a log or turtle move the frog it and report back.
        Returns:
        is the frog on a log or turtle or not

      • onWater

        private java.lang.Boolean onWater()
        Returns:
        if the player currently above water level on the map.

      • checkIfAtEnd

        public void checkIfAtEnd()
        Check if the player is at an end goal of the level and if so change the goals state and reset the frog to the start. If the player has already reached that goal state then just reset them to start, else increment score.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns:
        The Size of the player sprite.

      • getPoints

        public int getPoints()
        Returns:
        The number of points the player has

      • setPoints

        public void setPoints​(int value)
        Parameters:
        value - The value you want to set the new score to.

      • noMove

        public boolean noMove()
        If the frog is dying the frog should not be able to move.
        Returns:
        Can the frog move or not.

      • getLives

        public java.lang.Integer getLives()
        Returns:
        The number of lives the player has.

      • decrementLife

        public void decrementLife()
        Decreases the number of lives by one, when the player dies.
